thread.title: Futures fall again after Tuesday's bounce

title: Futures fall again after Tuesday's bounce
text:
February 7, 2018 / 12:02 PM / in 18 minutes Wall Street ends down after choppy session; energy, tech weigh Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - U.S. stocks closed lower in an up-and-down session on Wednesday, dragged down by tech and energy shares, as investors adjusted to a more volatile market following wild swings of the past few sessions. 
The Dow Jones Industrial Average .DJI fell 19.7 points, or 0.08 percent, to 24,893.07, the S&P 500 .SPX lost 13.51 points, or 0.50 percent, to 2,681.63 and the Nasdaq Composite .IXIC dropped 63.90 points, or 0.9 percent, to 7,051.98. Related Coverage
